Room was a bit small, but that's to be expected of Japanese hotels. The bathroom was awesome, as it had a full-size tub for a nice ofuro. Big, flat screen TV, clean carpets, and even had an air-purifier in the room, which was a nice touch. Overall, very clean, very quiet (except for the loud banging and moaning of two people making love next door at 3 AM in the morning, yeah it was quiet haha), very good location. Highly recommend this hotel for anyone, especially couples traveling to Tokyo.

I stayed here last December, absolutely lovely and very helpful staff. The room was gorgeous. I am not sure if there was room service I didn't see any menu so I didn't enquire so do find out before you stay. However across the road is a Starbucks and lots of eateries around. 3 minutes walk to the main Ginza street with the beautiful Louis Vuitton,Chanel and Bulgari stores. Very clean hotel, a really pleasant stay.

We stayed there for one night and we were very impressed with the hotel.Service was great and the hotel itself is quite new, so we felt comfortable.As expected, the room is not very big, but it was good size with a Japanese style bath room. Great location to walk around in Ginza. Mitsukoshi is the closest department store and not too far to Tsukiji, Kabuki theatre.. etc. As we book the room at last minuets, only smoking room was available, but luckily, we didn't smell much from this room. I only wish all rooms are non smoking!It is not cheap - but being central, it was reasonable price.

This hotel is located in the heart of Ginza area, within walking distance to Ginza and several subway stations. The restaurant served most fresh and delicious vegetables at breakfast when I stayed, with elegant and comfortable wooden furnitures.

We booked this hotel for 6nights after researching through numerous recommended hotels in Ginza. Stayed here with our 4year old boy. Initially, we were very skeptical as the boutique hotels rooms are usually super small but yo out surprised, we were given a corner room w a double bed. It was enough to sleep the 3 of us w room to place a pram n 2 31inches luggages. The location of this hotel deserves a 5 star! 1 min away, there's family mart for all your late nite cravings, 5mins away is the A2 exit of Ginza station (serving the Ginza, Marounouchi n Hibiya lines) also Mitsukoshi n Matsuya departmental store. There's tons of eateries ard n Ippudo (famous ramen chain in Japan) is just across the street fr the hotel!!!! Ginza is central when you wanna travel to Tokyo Disneyland, Odaiba for the kids n the high end stores for the adults. Most great places to have your yummy meals are all within walking distance... Midori Sushi Ginza, Ukai Tei Ginza (Michelin star Teppanyaki), kolloba Yakiniku, Asakusa Tendon (reasonable chain of tendons).

Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights. Booked a twin room even though I was staying alone. The room is more spacious than I thought and come with separate shower and bath tub. The hotel is just a stone's throw from Mitsukoshi and 10 minutes walk to Tsukiji Fish Market. Access to Haneda airport via the Asakusa line from nearby Higashi-Ginza Station.

We stayed for 10 nights in a twin room in December 2015 -- and we will stay again.The staff and service are amazing - they are there to help and always do so very quickly.The hotel is new -- and it makes everything a pleasure. The rooms sparkle. And the sizable lounge area is a great place to wait or meet people.The location is perfect -- a block from Mitsukoshi and major subway lines, and a short hike to Tokyo Station, the Imperial Palace, and Nihonbashi. The Solaria is in the heart of everything.There are plenty of places to stay in Ginza. Tiny rooms at decent prices, or luxury hotels with luxury prices. The Solaria has hit a wonderful spot -- decent sized room and a decent price. A lot of the strengths of the room comes down to design -- the closet is probably the best small closet I've seen in a hotel. It had enough room to empty my suitcase (packed for a 3 week trip) and store my suitcase.

This Hotel is in a great location with alot of very good eateries, shops, coffee shops nearby. It is walking distance to the Fish Market. Breakfast was superb, staff helpful and friendly. Our room was on the small side but it wasn't a problem for us. It was clean and very comfortable.

the hotel is located really near Ginza station (exit A12), with a lot of shops just around the corner. it's slightly off the main street, so you won't be expecting a lot of noise from the traffic. i stayed three nights in the hotel, the design is quite modern.i got the double room and was staying alone, i cannot imagine sharing the room with another person as i would have felt that it might be a little too cramp. the bed was comfortable and the toiletries provided were of very good quality. i would definitely stay here again the next time i visit Tokyo.

I was expecting a bigger hotel, but as they say size doesn't matter. Great location for Ginza. Metro station 5 minutes walk. Fish market 15 mins walk. All the main big stores are in walking distance such as Chanel, Louis Vuitton, Gucci etc etc.Room was clean with a nice deep bath and fantastic shower. Complimentary tea/coffee and water every day.Overall good hotel but a little expensive for what you are getting.

I stayed here during Hanami Holiday (March-April) 2015 for 3 nights. the hotel is strategically located in Ginza area, at the same neighbourhood (behind) of Mitsukoshi dept store in Ginza which is the landmark of Ginza. So you can feel living in the heartbeat of upper class Ginza district. Very convenient to walk around the blocks and explore those beautiful stores and boutiques in the area.  The hotel seemed quite new, room is rather small as standard hotels in Japan but very clean and complete amenities. the plus point to see is the room provides separate toilet cubicle, some it gives you very convenient feeling. The room is aired with good interior and good lighting. I stayed at the room for single occupancy so no view at all through the window. I am sure other room type has.very recommended 3-4star hotel in Ginza, the best in its class

The hotel location is great....two blocks from the subway (Ginza Line), making getting around really easy. It is exceptionally clean and with an upscale feel...without an upscale price. For us, travelling through Japan as a group of three adults can be tricky to find accommodations all together, but they gave us a nice corner room with with a very spacious bathroom. The beds were squeezed in a bit tight, but we managed fine. There are plenty of toiletries for your use and are replenished each day! Also, there is a convenient refrigerator and coffee maker for storing goods and starting your day as well as free wifi. The restaurant in the hotel appears to be very fancy and upscale...but sadly we didn't try it. We opted for the many local restaurants around the hotel for dinner. The front desk is super friendly and helpful, especially when we needed them to ship a left item to our next hotel! Recommended place for sure.

For 2 pax, we got the TWIN room which was just enough for 3 large luggages & a handcarry.Restaurants around: Ippudo is right beside it. Ikinari Steak is on the same street that serves good steak but is standing room only. Family Mart is a plus. Starbucks is just another block away.Mitsukoshi and Matsuya Malls are just 2-3 short blocks away.Drugstore is on the next street.

Great hotel for various reasons including amenities, size of room, and, most of all, location. On top of all that, the front desk staff is very courteous and willing the help. About the only drawback is the lack of a concierge which could come in handy for things like restaurant reservations when you don't really know the area.

The hotel location is the best, right inside the Ginza shopping area and lots of restaurants nearby. Also, there is a family mart just across to the hotel, less than 1 minute walk!.The room size is consider ok in Ginza area, and it is very clean and comfortable. Will come back next time!

Right in the heart of the fashionable Ginza district is this modern hotel. The staff at front desk are cry welcoming but the room is typically Japanese tiny. Lovely bathroom and easy to use AirCon together with a seperate air cleanser unit. Around the corner is our favourite place-Family Mart where we stock up on food and drinks!The hotel is very close to 2 Metro subway stations and about 10 mins walk to nearest JR station. Further away, about 15-20 mins walk is the main Tokyo staton.On departure, we walked with our luggage about 8 mins walk to the Narita express bus which takes 70-90 mins to get to Narita and only costs 1000 Yen. The hotel is not cheap and breakfast is not included and there is no spa/bathhouse but good position and facilities.

Pros: New, very clean, superb locations, trendy, close to malls and subway station, close to all the luxury brand boutiques, relatively quite compared to shinjukuCons: Extremely small, try to get the biggest room

The hotel is very well located in the nicest area in Tokyo.The room was small as in almost all japanese hotels, but very clean, confortable and elegant.In my opinion it is a little expensive but if you want to stay in Ginza, it is a very good choice.

Recently I stayed at this property for 4 nights in July, 2015. Hotel surroundings have plenty of restaurants in the area. Family Mart is right around the corner as well, for any convenience snacks past midnight. If it is raining during your visit, the hotel provides you with those clear white umbrellas. As for the room, I stayed in the smallest room they offer. The only hiccup I see is that my luggage was a medium sized piece and there was no place for me to store my luggage. But then, I did ask for a small room. As this was my first hotel stay in Tokyo, I think that I will be coming back to this hotel in my coming visits as well.

Like to know if we are able to check in around 10am without any additional charges being flight arrival at around 6.30am on 27th Jul. My Japanese boss had paid 2 nights 3 days stay at Solaria Ginza on 16th Jul already. We just need to take a shower and out of room around 11am for important meeting.

I've stayed for 4 days. Although it is a boutique hotel but everything was well-equipped from personal amenities to house keeping service. Love the lobby ambience, nearly fell asleep sitting on the couch !! A real comfortable and cozy hotel!!!

I stayed there in Dec 2014 and found it to be better than I'd thought. I've always tried to stay away from Ginza when it came to find a hotel thinking it's gonna be expensive and not my kind of area. Turned out I was wrong! Ginza quiet down in the evening so it is a good place to stay if you are not looking to party into the night. Many great restaurants are within walking distance from the hotel plus two big department stores. Ippudo is right opposite and opens till 3am. The hotel was new, well-kept and clean. The room on small side but it's Tokyo so it's normal. The staff was very helpful with restaurant reservation, recommendation and taxi booking. I had a very comfortable stay here and wished I'd chosen to stay here my entire trip instead of spending the last few days in a hotel in Shibuya. A mistake that wont happen again!

Stayed here with 4 of my friends last November 2014 and we found the location to be very ideal. It is less than 5 minutes walk from Ginza main street which means there is no problem finding restaurants, shops, and the metro station. The rooms are quite modern but small. The bathroom I gladly found to be bigger in relation to the room. The lobby is very small. Nevertheless, I'd recommend it to any of my friends and family who plan to visit Tokyo.

Very well located, 1min walk from higashi Ginza station or 10 min walk from Ginza station. Mitsukoshi shopping center just behind the hotel. Family mart around the corner and the famous ippudo ramen just downstairs. Tsikiji fish market just 10min walk. Nearby all shopping. Quiet place and nice hotel. Very friendly staff.

First, the location is really great to visit Western Tokyo (in the heart of Ginza close to 2 subway lines and 15-minute walk from the Tsukiji Market). The price was very good as well and the hotel was just opened. This being said, the rooms were really tiny. It's hard to express how small they are. Basically, it's too small for 2 people that have 2 regular luggage. There's no place to store your clothe. We were in another modern hotel in Shinjuku and the room was much bigger.Service is also so-so. All their restaurant advice were not very good. It seems that they just want to send you somewhere with minimal work. One even sent us to an Izakaya with no english or picture menu (the only one we saw without neither in Japan!). We also asked the lobby to call us a taxi at check-out. The person at the lobby (he was alone) said that it will take 20 minutes and that we will have to pay a surcharge directly to the taxi. We just went outside and got one after one minute.

Very convenient hotel with mostly Japanese guests. The rooms are very small. The double bed is against the wall and the bathroom small. The rooms would be perfect for one person but fine for two as long as you don't have a lot of luggage. The bed was very comfortable, the windows open, and the position is outstanding. It is very close to Kabuki, walking distance to the fish market, galleries and department stores. The metro station is very close by. The staff at the front desk were helpful in booking restaurants and for anything else we needed. We didn't eat at the hotel but the Family Store across the road had reasonably priced coffee, pastries, yoghurt and fruit which made breakfast easy. Much better than the cafes near the hotel. A little more storage in the room would be nice but we managed. The room was very clean and the internet speed very fast. Would be happy to stay there again

I stayed for 3 nights in June 2015. I did plenty of research for a hotel while I was in Tokyo and have to say my research paid off.The hotel is situated in the Gucci shopping district of Ginza. The quality of the room was exceptional - I had a standard double room and there was plenty of room with storage and even a small couch idea for chilling out.There was no noise issues from the corridor or other rooms and all items inside the room are of good quality. The rooms are very tidy, the an air-con unit that is easily controlled and smells fresh all the time.The bathroom was also very modern, clean and added grooming products were of a top brand.My only criticism is with the breakfast offered. It is pricey for what you get. The food is of good quality, however, there is limited choice. For someone who generally eats a western diet, I was limited to what I wanted to eat. I have seen better choices at other hotels. That said, it suited me for what I wanted and travelling alone it was convenient to eat at the hotel.It is literally around the corner from Higashi-Ginza metro station and easy to find. I cannot recommend this hotel enough. A decent price for a hotel of quality.

There's not a lot to say about this hotel really; it's a terrific, modern hotel situated in a prime location. Compared with equivalent hotels in New York or London, it's also great value. If you're looking for a good hotel in Tokyo, this is ideal.

We took Airport Limousine Bus, as we didn't want to carry our luggage up and down staircases in metro. The hotel was 7mins walk from the limousine bus stop, 15mins walk from Tsukiji Fish Market, 2mins walk from the closest Tokyo Metro (not JR), in which we took metro a lot.Staff had certain knowledge of English, they were friendly and have been helpful. The room was small but good enough, with Toto toilet bowl and standard size bathtub. We had a smoking room, the air purifier didn't help a lot so every time when we returned to our room it smelled like a chimney. Hotel guests can enjoy delivery of luggage at a low cost to the Tokyo Station by 11am in the morning. Perfect service for guests who have late flight and would like to hang around the city.

We stayed in this hotel in April 2015. A friend found it on the internet, we were 6 couples staying before we boarded the cruise ship. The rooms were adequately sized, clean and superbly positioned for the Ginza, underground, and the fish market. The hotel staff were very accomodating with a good knowledge of english. A very nice common area, and reasonably priced for the position. Highly recommended, i would certainly choose to stay there again.

We stay there for 6 days. It was perfect for Tokyo. Super Nice area , near subways and many many restaurants. Staff very polite , room super clean. Is a small hotel , with average room for japan , but you feel very welcome and all works perfect there. Best way the get there is by Bus from Narita Bus Terminal in Tokyo , taxi from there to the Hotel is near 1500 yen.be bak there for sure

We stayed there 2 nights in march 2015. Hotel is located in a high-end Tokyo district -Ginza, very close to the G and H metro line (we found both of them really convenient to get around). Hotel was really nice, good service, clean, nice room of an average size. We didn't have breakfast there but right outside the hotel there is a fantastic ramen place. We didn't find THAT good ramen during our stay in Japan again :) Overall we were verry happy with staying at Solaria.

There's a simple rule in big cities: real estate gets more expensive when you get closer to the city centre. And when you want to stay at the centre of the Tokyo, you either have to pay or accept a smaller room. The Solaria hotel in Tokyo found an excellent compromise between those two.The location is simple excellent: right in the middle of the main shopping street, behind one of the most famous shops (Mitsukoshi) at about a 1 minute walk from Higashi-Ginza station (take exit number 2).The building is very modern and stylish, and so is the lobby. Checkin was quick, as it should be. We booked a so-called "double room", which was rather small. The bathroom was cramped and the mattress too firm. After one night we upgraded to a "twin room" which was significantly larger with better beds and a more spacious bathroom. In either case the price was pretty fair considering the quality of the room and of course the location in Tokyo.In short: a pleasant stay and a recommendable hotel.

The room is very clean and the hotel is situated in the quiet elegant location.it is near to all like shopping malls and 7-11 and ginza station. It is a place where you just to take a walk in a chill mode..i love this hotel

This is a very nice hotel. Although rooms are quite small for western standards, they were larger than I expected for Japanese standards. Ginza is a great location. My only concern was related to the reception staff. They speak a very poor English.

We spent only one night at this hotel but we were there early on the first day and left late on day two. We had wonderful service from a number of people who were on reception at different times. The hotel amenities are perfectly adequate and the rooms, though a little smaller than some we have stayed in, we're very clean and comfortable. The highlight of a stay in this hotel is the location. We walked to many places and had access to two metro stations giving a choice of several subway lines.

Room a little small; internet very good @ 10mbs download - wifi and wired; has automated toilet with bidet and warm seat; hot water is very good and very reliable; shower is integrated with bath tub; very near subway station ginza line, hibiya line, marunochi line, and jr line; everything is self service, very clean room!; room is well maintained; near disney land; staff is very friendly but their english is not that good so be prepared; moderned look, theme, or design; has nespresso (espresso machine); has panasonic vaporizer or humidifier.

This hotel is as perfectly located as one could wish in Tokyo. It is within the Ginza area, with an easy walk to any of the places in the district. The staff at the desk are competent, and helpful, without being effusive. The room was possibly the smallest I have encountered in 60 years of traveling. Any smaller, and it would be considered a pod. It is, of course, immaculate. There are nice, though not spectacular, views from the rooms on the higher floors.The breakfast buffet is more than adequate without coming close to being lavish. The same dishes seem to be served every day.

New hotel, perfect choice for our 4-nights stay in Tokyo. This hotel is located just a very short walk to Matsuya & Mitsukoshi, easily accessed from Higashi-Ginza (Hibiya Line) and Ginza station (Marunochi or Asakusa line). It definitely is value for money, so worth it. I couldn't find any flaw when staying in Solaria Nishitetsu hotel. Highly recommended.

I picked this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and I was not disappointed. Solaria Hotel is located in the heart of Ginza. I stayed for five nights with my wife and two teens. We had two bedrooms, size of rooms is smaller as expected in Tokyo. However, they had all necessary amenities and services. Hotel has details of technology in many areas. My teens were very pleased with the WiFi speed.Ginza is the most upscale section in Tokyo. The hotel is on walking distance of the two most important streets. The decor is modern and stylish. Staff were incredibly helpful and gave us good restaurant recommendations. Many stores, good cafes and restaurants are within walking distance.It was very easy to find taxis which was our preferred means of transportation. The Hotel also has a restaurant on the second floor of excellent quality.

The hotel is a modern high rise located just 2 blocks away from Mitsukoshi, the largest department store in Ginza and just 1 block from the Ginza subway. The location of this hotel is very important especially in a city like Tokyo where distances are enormous and public transportation just super - people will help you out with the purchase of tickets. The people working in the hotel either at the reception or in the breakfast room were very very helpful and extremely gracious. Breakfast was served buffet style and had a nice choice of Western and Japanese food. Our bedroom (805) was nice, roomy and quiet taking into account that one is in the center of the city. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Stayed in Ginza for five nights. The hotel has three train stations nearby, major shopping stores within a few blocks, and great places to eat! What else can You ask for? The staff are extremely helpful and friendly. They are very patient in explaining the train system. One female staff even went beyond her duties and called toys r us for a toy we were looking for. We booked premium twin with extra bed. A bit cramped but the beds were comfy. Toilet and bath tub are unbelievable! Really relaxing after long day of walking. Cant go wrong if you book here. Train station that takes you stright to haneda airport is just one block away. Be sure to ask staff where to go for exits with elevator as you have to carrybags down several flight of stairs if you dont choose the exit with elevators.

This hotel is very conveniently located near the shopping mecca, the Ginza. Directly north a couple blocks is Apple's store. Across the street are Cartier, Bulgari, Tiffany's, Chanel, and many many others. There are also multilevel superstar department stores such as Mitsukoshi and Matsuya, where there are floors specifically dedicated to men and women's clothing and accessories, household gift items, art works, and food items in the basement level floors.There is also a great breakfast included, with western style and Japanese dishes to select from. Staff there are most courteous and helpful. The restaurant also serves lunch and dinner selections, which we did not have a chance to try during this visit.Our room was located on the 5th floor with a view of the adjacent building. Room size was not large, but we found it to be very functional and with sufficient amenities to enjoy our four night stay in comfort. The elevators and outer door access is controlled by your room key (with electronic chip) so that elevator only stops on your floor. The same occurs when leaving your room, all lighting and AC are turned off, which conserves energy. There are many outlets available to charge your phones, camera batteries, or pocket wifi (highly recommend renting a pocket wifi; put phone on airplane mode, web accessible throughout our visit, even on Shinkansen).Only complaint was that due to our close proximity to the elevator, there was a dinging sound whenever the elevator was approaching our floor. On the flip side, we had quick access to the elevator with our luggage.There is also a Family Mart convenience store nearby on the southeast side of the hotel that you can buy late night snacks or drinks.The location is within walking distance to other well known attractions, such as Tsukiji Market and the Imperial Palace grounds, in addition to the many shops in the area. Word of caution: items are quite pricey, so buyer beware; found many of the same items on the web at reduced prices. It is also conveniently located to Tokyo's transportation network and access to them.This hotel is definitely someplace we could return to in the future!

The Solaria Nishitestsu really is an ideal base in Tokyo to explore Ginza and the rest of the city.I had requested a Twin Room on booking (even though it was our honeymoon) as I had read previous reviews stating that there was much more room in these. After spying some double rooms in our corridor, I was pleased to find these review comments were true - the twin rooms were almost double the size. We pushed the beds together, moved a table out of the way and all in all, it made for a perfect (if not a little compact) sized room for our 7 day break.On check in, we were given a pamper pack of toiletries - the service was quick and faultless. The front desk staff all spoke excellent English and recommended some great local spots for a late dinner. We were up on the 13th Floor - and I was impressed with how clean and well laid out the rooms were. The bathrooms comprised of a wonderful 'Japanese' style toilet (with all the gadgets) a basin area and then a separate wet room with a bath and shower. The TV had plenty of channels but only 2 english channels - both news. Not a problem for us as we were out every day, all day.The location is absolutely perfect for not only venturing around Ginza but hopping on the Ginza Subway line which connects to Tokyo Station and many other major subway lines around Tokyo. However, most mornings we took the leisurely 20 minute walk to Tokyo Station to hop on the main circular Yamanote Line which pretty much stops at all the 'main places' you will likely want to go in Tokyo. The hotel itself is one block back from the main Ginza street which becomes pedestrianized on a Saturday - many of the streets lining the hotel are quaint, tree lined avenues dotted with impressive fashion stores and restaurants.  Across the street and a little way down is a Starbucks - which we would stop off at each morning as things in Tokyo really don't get going until after 10AM. We also found the 11th and 12th floor restaurants in the nearby Mitsukoshi Ginza department store to be a really great choice for lunch (The Okonomiyaki and Tonkatsu places were outstanding!). A highly recommended 'To Do' in the vicinity would to head to Tsjuki Fish Market - we walked from the hotel (around 20 mins) and spent a good few hours taking in all of the weird and wonderful sights. It truly is a sight you have to see.All in all, a great base in an ideal location in the heart of Tokyo! After seeing all over Tokyo in the 7 days we were there, I was really pleased we had chosen the upmarket and lovely Ginza as our base. It was perfect!

Loved the location in the Ginza District. So much was within walking distance.Unfortunately husband Jon felt unwell when we first arrived, so we needed an early check-in quickly....Gastric distress, don't you know.The staff was definitely uncooperative in dealing with this situation, not the least helpful, thus my LOW rating of service.The hotel was immaculately clean, rooms small, and dining too expensive. But the location was terrific.

Solaria rooms, like most hotel rooms in Tokyo, are not big, but not too cramped either and very functional. The room and the hotel itself were clean and very well maintained. Wifi was fast.Location was the best thing about Solaria. Despite being in the heart of Ginza, there is a peacefulness to the surrounding area so unlike the noisy, crowded, cramped and fast paced vibe in places like Shinjuku, Shibuya, Akihabara. You can relax and chill and yet not be so far from the action.Solaria is directly in front of Ippudo for some great ramen and gyoza, and a couple of steps away from Ikinari, awesome steak by the gram, and very great value. Family Mart convenience store, Starbucks, McDonalds, St. Marc Cafe are also all just within a minute or two away. To and from the airport is also very convenient via train as the Higashi-Ginza exit is also just 2 minutes away. If you have luggage, suggest you take the A1/A2 exit as these have elevators and are very close to the hotel. Several subway exits also nearby to take you all around Tokyo. Shopping also close by as giant chains such as Bic Camera, Muji, Mitsukoshi, Itoya, Tokyu Hands, Matsuya Ginza, Apple Store, Don Quixote, Uniglo, are all within 5-10 minutes away. Hard to go wrong with the location and value.

The location of this hotel is excellent. 3 mins walk to Ginza apple store, must-try Ippudo resto and Ikinari steak beside the hotel, with lots of cute familiar shops, you will never run out of things to do around the area. The rooms are very clean and bathroom amenities are above average. Rooms are quite small but average compared to other hotels in Tokyo. Get a bigger room when booking this hotel because upgrade would be almost impossible when you check in as the hotel is always fully booked. Only thing I wouldn't recommend is their breakfast which was lacking in selection. There are numberous coffee shops in the area to choose from so I suggest you just explore the area for breakfast. I will book this hotel again next time I visit Tokyo.

This is a great functional hotel in an excellent location. The room are slightly larger than most of Japanese hotel (not that much bigger) but the bathroom is definitely larger than most of the Japanese hotel I have stayed in, given the price. Don't expect too much facilities but the location and the comfort of the room make up for it.The only drawback is the wifi somehow does not work very well with my Mac. Room to improve on I guess.

My husband and I liked this hotel. The rooms are not large, but very functional. Great location close to fish market and Tokyo station and Kabuki theater. Imperial palace within walking distance. Wifi a little sketchy. I would definitely return. A bargain.

Stayed twice at the Solaria , first in the standard room on the third floor, small but clean and comfortable. Free WI-FI worked great, amenities kept to minimum. Second time on the penthouse with high ceiling room, cost twice but pretty much worth on extra space, modern decorations and reasonable amenities as well as a bit of panoramic view. On both occasions staff were helpful and efficient. Location is the essence of staying here, right there everything are on short walking distant. Perfect !

Given how Tokyo hotels are know for their (lack of) space, Solaria was a very pleasant surprise. Not only was my room pleasantly spacious, there was even a bathtub!Ginza isn't everyone's idea of convenience if all you're interested in is walking out of your hotel and be instantly on the busy streets of Shinjuku or Shibuya but within Ginza itself, Solaria is very conveniently located just a hop and skip from the main shopping street, the metro and big department stores like Mitsukoshi.-Service was courteous and helpful. I would stay again.

The Solaria Hotel in Ginza was an absolute gem! Rooms may be small but the space planning was so well thought out that it could accommodate separate shower, toilet and washbasin areas! The shower/bathtub area even had a glass facade (with blinds provided for the shy ones!). The location was practically in the heart of the Ginza shopping area surrounded by lots of restaurants, food outlets, convenience stores and departmental stores. Also, about a 200m walk away, is the bus stop for the Narita Airport bus which we took for our flight home. Its direct to the airport after making just one stop at the Tokyo train station and its only 1,000 yen per pax with no limit to the number of luggage. So very convenient! Overall it was more than value for money and we will definitely stay there again should we plan to stay in the Ginza area again during our next trip.

We stayed in this hotel on the last leg of our japan trip and it was a great hotel to finish with! Very convenient, about 10 minutes walk from the JR Yurakucho station (which is only 1 stop away from tokyo station on the Yamanote line) and 3 minutes away from the local ginza metro line, its a great location to see Tokyo from.The room was big for tokyo standards as well, and very comfortable. The staff were polite and helpful, without being intrusive. Since everything was prepaid, it made checking out of the hotel at 5am very quick and low maintenance.There is a very convenient little computer set up downstairs, with two computer available for guest use. The best part was, there was also a little printer that you could use without having to pay or ask for help, which made checking into our flight extremely easy.If you are a mini-bar enthusiast, this hotel will disappoint as there is no mini bar that we could find in the room. However, there is a family mart across the road, which will hopefully be able to provide for all of your mini-bar needs.

We stayed five nights and this was a good choice to the Ginza area as it is just a few minutes walk along very pleasant streets to several metro lines providing easy access to most of Tokyo. Many nice eating choices around the hotel from the foodhall delights of Mitsokoshi Dept store to fine dining. You need to look above ground as many are located on upper floors. The room was, as reported, small but very well fitted out and spotlessly clean. Good and free wifi connection. Service was efficient. We didn't have breakfast but there are plenty of options in surrounding cafes. Would stay here again. Taxi was 760Yen from Tokyo station. Puzzled why only one English station (BBC) on TV when rest of the world provide a variety.

This hotel is clean, modern, comfortable. Staff is friendly. Location is walking distance to subway. Starbucks and Family Mart near by for coffee/snacks. Was able to walk over to the Tsujiki Fish Market in 10 minuted at 3 am to get a spot to view the tuna auction. We also happened to walk by the National Kabuki Theater which is located around the corned and were able to get same day tickets to watch a show - what a treat. Ginza and its stores are all around. Wireless reception in the room was very spotty and slow.

We checked into the hotel for one night only as a stopover in Tokyo before heading to Osaka the next day. Centred in the classy uptown Ginza area, the hotel is conveniently located within a short minute of walking from the Higashi-Ginza subway station (exit A8), which was easy enough to travel to from Haneda airport.The hotel itself is classy and compact with tasteful wood and glass furnishing. Plenty of restaurants and cafes can be found within a 5-minute walking radius, and slightly further is the famed Mitsukoshi building. Genkatsu Ginza Ten served up the best rose pork katsu, and we had coffee and dessert at hip basement artisan coffee shop Sanjikken Coffee House.The room was tiny as expected since this is Tokyo and Ginza no less. That said, the sheer economy of space was inspiring. Bed abuts the shower and toilet which can be screened off for privacy. The room came complete with a tv, trouser press, narrow closet for clothes, table and safe deposit box.If you're not too fussed about the space or otherwise traveling alone, I'd highly recommend this lovely hotel. Would be back for sure.

In Japan, it is important to have internet access. And this hotel offers free wifi. Excellent connection. Ginza is like causewaybay of hong kong, for me :) so it's nice to stay in this vicinity. Lots of ramen places too.

The location of this hotel is great. Ginza is a very high end area and this hotel is very beautiful and modern. I love being able to walk to all the shops. The convenience store is right outside. Great to get snacks and drinks etc. the staff was really friendly at this hotel..Very helpful. The room itself is very small but that is normal for japan. We loved the robes and slippers and the awesome toto toilet. This is one of our favorite hotels. The subway ginza station was 2 blocks away. Very convenient and close walk to everything

The location was great to visit Tokyo. There are metro and train stations close by. Staff was attentive, helpful and nice. Always with a smile. Rooms are a little small, but which arent in Tokyo. Amenities were very useful.

My second stay here did not disappoint. 4 nights and 5 days. Late check-out = no problem.Still super clean and super quiet. Great bed linens and pillow options.Short cab ride to/from Tokyo Station for the Narita Express.Very close to Metro station, Starbucks, great shopping and a short walk to a lovely park for morning work-outs.Morning buffet breakfast is pretty good - especially compared to other places we tried, at more expensive hotels, for a lot more money.

銀座からも、東銀座駅からもとても近く、またコンビニやレストランも近いので非常に便利です。エレベーターがカード式でかざすと泊まる階に行けます。次回来た際にはまた泊まりたいと思いました。Also from the Ginza, it is near also from Higashiginza Station and a convenience store and a restaurant are also near, it is very convenient. elevator runs by a card. I wished to stay again, when it came next time.

My teenage son and I stayed at the Solaria in a corner twin bed room for seven days on the third floor in November 2014. It is a new hotel with all the mod-cons. Comfortable beds, very clean and modern bathroom complete with techno Japanese toilet and separate shower and bath. The room was quiet, beautifully cleaned and maintained during our stay. The staff spoke English and were very helpful in our request for an iron and laundry exchange. We dined at the buffet breakfast twice, each time enjoying a small but quality offering.The location in Ginza is excellent and very central and convenient. We accessed the JR trains and subway from the nearby Ginza station easily and on our departure made use of the close express coach service to Narita Airport from Ginza Station.The elegant Solaria has all the services of a major chain hotel franchise without the jaded attitude many succumb to over time.

I have stayed in many hotels around Ginza in the past: Courtyard by marriott, Gracery, etc... This hotel is by far the best value for money without compromising quality, space and location. I was pleasantly surprised by how generous the space is within the hotel. The corridors are wide and well lit. Rooms are large by Tokyo standard. Their twin beds are comfortable and placed next to each other with enough walking room to get around. We have 4 luggages and were about to move about the room without difficulties. The most impressive part was the bathroom! I haven't see such a large bathroom including a separate standing shower and bathtub in Ginza area before. This is my go to hotel in Tokyo going forward.

Room is very modern, size is big* for Tokyo standard and I considering how much I paid for this place, I'm pretty happy with value for $$ (yen) :) Cons: power plus are all only non earthed. Luckily I brought one that doesn't have the earth ping. I used the earth plug with the plug inside the safe :) as its a cord and the earth pin doesn't get in the way. The room is very small for European standards, but like I said, u have to pay a lot more if u want a bigger room. The wifi internet speed is abysmal. Super duper dial up slow esp at peak times thoughout the day. I hope they fix this for future visitors. Can hardly use the Internet 80% of the time. Only one English channel on tv (bbc news). D Life channel is a hit and miss with English content showing VERY old shows or stupid under the dome at 11pm.Pros: location to shops and restaurants is simply too good to be true. Ippudo is basically next door serving yummy ramen. Family mart is less than a min walk for drinks and all sorts of snacks. The air cond is nice and cool, dehumidifier is useful for drying my clothes :) . Curtains block out light pretty well, valcro on the sides make sure it's stuck down and u can sleep till 1pm. Btw, nothing much opens till 11am so do sleep in. Unless you wanna go Disneyland (which I don't suggest). Mitsukoshi level 11 has yummy food is only 5min walk. Matsuya basement has heaps of food stalls for your taste buds 5min away. Yakitori rainway alley is about 10-15min walk, good if u like to sit with a bunch of smokers. Plenty of ammenities. Tooth brush paste, hair brush etc, decent bath tub.

My family and I spent 6 nights at the hotel. We all had a wonderful stay here.The thing we love most about this hotel is the location. Situates right at the center of Ginza makes it super convenient to stroll along Ginza. Tons of restaurants, shops, and cafes around the hotel. The foodhall at the basement of Mitsukoshi is heaven. Just 5-min walk to the subway station ( took 10 for us as we have one active kid who loves running around). The room is of standard size for most typical hotels in Tokyo. I personally like to bathroom. Although it's not large, but it's not small considering the overall size of the room.It's very functional and very clean. The concierges can speak English far better than we expected. Definitely come back again.

Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights during the Tokyo trip on October 2014. I stayed with my wife and 2 kids (age 6 and 2.5). I booked the twin room, and the bed can be joined together.The room is clean, size is OK for Japan. There are rooms to move around. Amenities is quite good.The hotel location is near the Higashi-ginza station, it's about 3 mins walk. If you coming from Ginza station, it's a little further, around 10 mins walk if you have your luggage with you. You need to find exit A13 (through Matsuya Dept Store) to get near the hotel.Family mart (same as 7-11) is just across the road. If you need to catch or coming from/to Narita Limousine Bus, closest stop is at Courtyard by Marriot Ginza. We are catching the bus to Narita, it only 3 blocks away from the hotel, 5 mins walk. You can leave your luggage at Courtyard after you buy the ticket, if you are not staying at Courtyard.If I stay at Ginza again, we'll come back to this hotel for the value and location. But, I may not stay in Ginza again as it's a business district.

Very reasonably priced. The hotel had a great location too-- it was just a few minutes walk to both the shopping centres in Ginza and both the Higashi Ginza and Ginza train stations. There were lots of nice restaurants around too (Ippudo, Zakuro, and the list goes on). The room is small (as to be expected from Tokyo) and basic but quite comfortable with a decent-sized bathroom. The free high speed wifi was a really great perk too.

Great Location with a Friendly Attentive Staff If you are looking for a hotel in Ginza for a reasonable price that puts you in the heart of everything then this isn't a bad choice. Free water, not a big deal but after a long flight its nice to get some water and not get nickle and dime'd. Got to the fish market easily, got to shopping easily, got to the subway easily. Small rooms, but it's Japan.

Overall a very nice experience at Solaria- staff friendly and helpful, great location for cuisine and shopping and easy to arrive from Tokyo Station. The rooms are a good size for what you pay value with Ikea type smart ergonomic touches for space use. Will stay there again.

My wife and I decided to stay a couple of days in Tokyo after we disembarked from our Transpacific cruise. After searching through the reviews of Tokyo hotels, I chose this one for us. I must say that the reviews were correct, this hotel was a wonderful find! We went to the hotel early, hoping to check in and leave our bags to go explore, but we were told we had to come back after 3:00 PM. This was not an issue since the reservation made this clear. However, I did have to be a bit persistent in asking them to check our luggage so we could go out and explore. The person who I spoke with wasn't fluent in English, so I had to use a translator app on my cell phone to communicate. When we returned that evening, we checked in and were amazed at the level of security the hotel had. The elevator will not allow you to select a floor, but you have to touch your key against a sensor in the elevator and it lights up your floor for you. The rooms were fully stocked with everything you need; shampoo, conditioner, liquid soap, slippers for the room and another pair for the bathroom, pajamas and more! The staff was very friendly and accommodating. We felt very welcome and the housekeeping staff couldn't do enough to help you. Checkout was also very easy, they called us a taxi to take us to Tokyo Station to catch our train to the airport. What I liked most about this hotel was the great security, free WiFi and a staff that is eager to please! When I had WiFi issues an employee brought an Ethernet Adapter to my room and set it up. This gave me my own little hotspot and wonderful speeds! The hotel is also a 5 minute walk to the subway/metro.The only area that could have been improved on would be to have additional staff that is fluent in English. Having my Japanese translator app on my cell phone, I was able to communicate with little effort, but I can see where others might have some issues.

Ginza is a fantastic area with quality shopping and the fish market supplying lots of fresh produce to restaurants all over the place... I was here on business and really enjoyed being able to stay in the middle of a buzzing city and yet being so peaceful in my room.The facilities are very good, staff are polite and very helpful. Yes there are some staff whose english could be better but believe me - their worst english was far far better than my japanese by a very long mile!In true japanese style, they were eager to please and provide directions, which made my experience of this city all the more enjoyable. The only drawback is that WiFi was very slow and poor from a performance point of view - so of you need very good WiFi then perhaps you;d be better off renting some of the portable options available in Japan.That said, I was here only for 3 days and it made such and impression that I can't wait to come back with my wife for a holiday.

We split our stay in Tokyo between Shinjuku and Ginza. We stayed here for a few days and found it to be a great location to explore a different part of Tokyo. It was a short walk to the Tsukiji Fish Market and its wonderful sushi restaurants as well as the Kabukicho theatre which was only around the corner.The express subway to the airport was directly outside the hotel which was handy as you did not have to go through one of the large, busy stations with bags like the Tokyo Station. The hotel was nice and modern with polite and helpful staff just like everywhere else we stayed in Japan. Would definitely recommend it!

After a 14-hour plane ride from New York, we arrived at Narita airport in Tokyo, and took a pleasant train ride into the city, arriving at this lovely hotel. We found the staff very accommodating, however their command of English was not great - but we managed to have them do everything we needed during our stay. Our room was small with very little space to place our clothes or luggage. Having said that, we did enjoy our stay there. The room was extremely quiet because the hotel was not on a main street. This was important to use in order to get a good night sleep after a very long trip and an even longer day. The bathroom was very nice, with a shower and tub and a fully automatic Japanese toilet seat that was heated and had buttons to automatically use the bidet that was part of of the seat. The room was immaculately clean.The location was excellent. We stayed in the Ginza section of town with large department stores everywhere. The subway was only several blocks away. This convenience allowed us to travel all over Tokyo with ease. Using the subway system was a snap after learning how their ticketing system works.We had them hold and transfer our bags to our next hotel in Kyoto because we were going to an out of the way Ryoken in Hakone for 2 days, and did not want to be burdened with all of our heavy luggage on the train to Hakone. We just packed enough clothes for two nights and carried that with us. When we arrived in Kyoto days later, our luggage was waiting for us at the hotel. The Japanese are extremely efficient.I rated this hotel a 9 out of 10. We wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Solaria is in a great spot in Ginza. Room was clean, but very small. Was my first time in Tokyo so I cannot compare, but with a twin bed and my suitcase there was not room for much else. The price was very reasonable. Strictly a business-style hotel. No pool, no fitness center.One note, no concierge, and the staff have very little knowledge of the area. Asked for directions for a particular noodle house. Receptionist drew us a route on the map that required about ten blocks of walking. No restaurant there. Turns out it was literally across the street from the hotel.

We stayed seven nights in a twin room. The room was not overly spacious and lacked drawers or shelves to put your clothes, which meant we kept part of our clothes in the suitcase thus having less floor space. The room itself is spotless, stylish and the bathroom has some nice amenities. Housekeeping did a perfect job so no complaints here. The system to make yourself a fresh cup of coffee is pretty ingenious and the ground coffee was of good quality.The breakfast had two hot items which alternated and the other items were the same every day.Quality of the food was excellent, service fast and staff friendly. We enjoyed the breakfast, but think that guests that stay longer might want some variation.Frontdesk staff is polite and quite a few spoke English well. Some days we were greeted when we entered, some days we were not. Location is excellent with a short walk to the subway and to shops and restaurants. The free wifi was blazing fast.When one paid attention to the details like the elevator key system, the lighting and decoration it is clear that this is an upscale hotel. Although more non Japanese stay in the hotel, the atmosphere was very much Japanese: extremely polite and perhaps a bit distanced.There were however building activities going on that spoiled one mornings sleep. No use asking for another room, as all the larger rooms were facing the same side. Since it happened only one morning it did not influence the rating.When returning to Tokyo we will certainly consider staying at this hotel again.

As all other reviews suggested, this is an excellent choice at the very reasonable (Tokyo) price. only 3-4 min walk to Ginza metro where 3 lines pass through. many restaurants and shops around.staff friendly, rooms clean, rooms are of course small for western size but that is Tokyo. everything is very practical and functional in the room. only comment: wifi is a bit slow

I have chosen this hotel because of the location, stayed there 2 nights - the receptionist spoke very good English at check-in, BUT the next day there were another receptionists and seemed they did not understand anything!! I had to make a local call from the room to discuss a meeting in Tokyo- it is IMPOSSIBLE! You must buy a telephone card that is rather complicated for even DOMESTIC call! Nobody helps to deliver luggage to the room - I had to carry 2 large suitcases myself. Rooms are very small.

review_body: Excellent location in Ginza. The location is between two subway stations, making access to any points around Tokyo extremely easy. The price point cannot be beat. We stayed in a room with two twin beds. The room is of reasonable size. Keep in mind the rooms in Japan are generally built to accommodate people of Asia, not plus sized people from the West. That being said, the bath and shower is really well built and quite large. The shower does not have to be stepped up into like a tub which makes it great for those with physical limitations. The room comes with a safe, fridge, and pants press. The closet is large enough to accommodate two people comfortably, unlike other hotels in Japan. The staff was very friendly and extremely professional (another common trait in Japan). Even with limited English they manage to communicate very well. In the many times we've been to Japan, for the price, this has to be one of the best hotels.

Rooms:Clean, small, but functional. Wifi kept kicking us off randomly for no apparent reason. Beds were somewhat hard but surprisingly comfortable anyway. The A/C settings were all in Japanese but when we figured it out it all worked fine.Location:Near to both JR and the metro. There are many restaurants and shops near by; if you want Kobe Beef I can recommend Gyu-An.Most of the shopping around the hotel was high-end and basically all the same stuff we can get at home (cheaper) anyway, so on our next trip we would not pick the Ginza area. We ended up doing most of our purchases in Akihabara, Ueno and Shinjuku, where we found less "fancy" stores that were more to our taste.Family Mart right across the street, but you might want to walk to the Hanamasa to get your food items and drinks way cheaper. The Access Narita bus (http://accessnarita.jp/en/home/) was very cheap and easy way to get to the hotel.Breakfast:Almost the EXACT same breakfast every day. The only difference was the rice dish of the day (hot). Very limited "western" options, and mostly cold food only (various salads). The restaurants is pretty small but we managed to avoid any waiting.After a few days we regretted paying for the breakfast at all (on top of the already very pricy room rate). I would say the breakfast was the most disappointing part of our stay.In summary: It was alright, but you can probably get something similar at a lower price if you pick one of the other areas of Tokyo (Shinjuku, Shibuya) instead.Tip: Get a b-mobile visitor SIM card for your phone. Getting around was so much easier using Google Maps, which can also give you metro routes and prices.

We stayed at Solaria Hotel in Ginza for four nights and enjoyed it very much. It was well located being close to a few train stations that gave you easy access to different lines. There is a direct train from Haneda Airport which stops at the Higashiginza station. The train journey took roughly 40 minutes. Do be careful of which train to board from the airport though. Not all the trains would stop at Higashiginza Station. There is a disable lift at the station that was great for us with suitcases and a stroller. The hotel is only five minutes walking away. The twin room we stayed at was small, although not small by Tokyo standards. The room was well designed with even a sofa. The bathroom was spacious. Furnishing was all new. Sound proofing for the rooms seemed to be good which was great for us with a toddler. Staff was friendly and gave excellent service. One gentleman helped us to call a metro station to retrieve our lost bags left on a metro train. The neighbourhood was quiet and felt very safe. Plenty of dining options were available to us. We were able to walk to the Fish Market, the shopping district and Tokyo Station didn't seem too far away too if you don't mind a long stroll. In summary, we really enjoyed the four day stay at the hotel and would highly recommend it to family and friends. The only thing that would make me hesitate is the pricing of the rooms which did not include breakfast.

Great hotel, great location in Ginza, about 20 minute walk from the Tsujiki fish market. The room was larger than we expected and with all the amenities we like to have - a refrigerator, blow dryer, very comfortable bed, good ventilation, room darkening curtains, good internet which is included in the rate. Breakfast is an outstanding extensive buffet in a lovely restaurant. We had breakfast 3 days ($21/person) and ate out more cheaply the other days which is a good balance for us. The lobby area is small without gift shops which is fine for us but may not be for others. We can't wait to return to Tokyo and will definitely stay here again.

Location: As many others have noted, the hotel is located in a very convenient location. You are within a 5 minute walk to the heart of Ginza. You are also a couple of minutes away from the Ginza subway station and a 5 minute walk from the Narita Access bus stop (more on this later). There is a Starbucks a minute or two away, which was very handy for breakfast as we did not opt for the hotel breakfast.Getting here: If you are taking the subway from anywhere, get off at Ginza and follow the signs for exit A12. When you get to street level, walk left. You will see a Starbucks and shortly after will see the hotel's sign on top of the building.From the airport, opt for the Access Narita option (http://accessnarita.jp/en/home/). It's 1000 yen per person each way. The bus stop is located right when you walk outside the terminal (there are 2 stops at either end, so walk left or right when you walk out of the airport to get to stop A2 or A19. Plenty of luggage room on the bus. The bus will drop you right by the main intersection at Ginza. When you get off the bus, turn to face the road, look left and you will see a store sign for "Paradise Dynasty". Walk straight down that street and you will reach the hotel.Room: Room were nice and clean. We stayed in a Double Room and found that sufficient for 2 people. A little small by North American standards but that is to be expected. Food: Plenty of options nearby, but I will focus on Halal food as those are usually harder to find for those with dietary restrictions. There are 2 restaurants within a 5-10 minute walk from the hotel. We tried both, 1 Malaysian (Rasa Malaysia) and 1 Indian (Annam Restaurant). Both were a little on the pricier side but that is to be expected given the location. These can be a little tricky to find. When you get to the main Ginza intersection, walk on the main street with the Sapporo building on the left and Ricoh building on the right, Walk on the left side. When you see Mizuho bank, take a left on that street. The second or third building has both restaurants and has an "Asics" sign on the top. There are small signs for the restaurant on the building as well.Overall: We had a great stay at the hotel and would definitely recommend. The staff was helpful, although English seemed a little limited. However, the lady was definitely making an effort to be very clear and I thoroughly appreciated it.

This is a wonderful find in the Ginza area. Rooms are spacious by japanese standards, & nothing beats the location! Close to shopping, lots of dining options, within walking distance to 3 train lines--what more can you ask for? Upon their suggestion, we chose their premium twin room--being a corner room it is definitely more spacious and can easily fit our 3 beds. Loved the huge windows & definitely enjoyed the BIG bathroom. would definitely stay there again!

Rooms are very clean and large compared to the average size of Hotel room in Tokyo. Don not worry if you have forgotten your toilet items, you have everything in the bathroom!The situation in GINZA is perfect, very central from all activities and METRO Ginza is only 5 minutes by walking.

The hotel is located in an excellent location within walking distance to two stations (that gets you on the Ginza, Hibiya, Marunouchi and Asakusa lines), walking distance to the Ginza stores, Hibiya park, Hamarikyu and a metro trip to Asakusa, and access to food from the department stores such as Mitsukoshi or Matsuya for a cheaper-than-a-restaurant dining option. There are 5* hotels along the Imperial park but the location of the Hotel Solaria is handy and more value for money. On top of the excellent location, the staff were excellent and extremely helpful - from advice on taking a taxi when there maybe a chance of rain and organising postage to the airport. The only thing to note is that the rooms are relatively small compared to US or Australian hotels, but you would pay an extra US$100+ more for the extra room. Our room still had a roomy shower and bath area, the beds were comfortable and the room quiet.

Solaria is perfectly located in the heart of Ginza, a trendy Tokyo district. Our 2 twin beds room was on a small side per the US standards, but efficiently designed. The price was about $200.00 per night, but breakfast was not included. Everything in the room had its purpose. Small things like sleepers, light robes, shaving razors and cream, toothbrushes, bottled water, little refrigerator, coffee and tea, etc., etc., make ones stay very comfortable. The front desk staff was very helpful in directing us to dining spots and entertainment. Solaria is located within a short walk to the Tokyo subway and within 15 min walk to the famous Fish Market. It was a perfect hotel for our first visit to Tokyo.

Solaria is a well located hotel in Ginza. Less than 3 blocks from 2 subway stations in a really nice neighborhood. The rooms are a bit small, but very well laid out. Free internet has average speed. I would definitely stay in this hotel if I return to Tokyo.

Stayed in this hotel for four nights in April 2014. Perfectly located only minutes from Ginza shopping region, and surrounded by plenty of eateries. The hotel is also very conveniently located close to Metro and JR rail stations. Lovely clean room and very helpful staff.

best location in the heart of ginza. very comfortable small room with a lot of facilities. good atmosphere and service. we enjoyed our staying very much. be aware that if you want to get a room and good price you must book many months in advance!!

When looking on search engines for Tokyo hotels, the price for the Solaria seemed 'wrong' given the location (more in line with less well located hotels). Suspecting there was probably a good reason for that, I made the reservation. Fortunately, Solaria turned out to be excellent value for its location in the heart of Ginza: Modern & well-appointed rooms that are spotlessly clean. Slightly on the small side, but this is Tokyo. The hotel has no amenities, but with so much going on in Ginza, you don't really need it. There is a restaurant on the 2nd floor. Limited wardrobe space in the rooms and no drawer space - if there are 2 of you, you won't be unpacking your suitcases.

We enjoyed our stay at Solaria. Service is top notched. And the hotel is very centrally located. Just a min walk to Higashi-ginza metro and 5 min walk to Ginza metro. My kids loved the rooms and the cleanliness of the place too. Fully equipped, love the shower, bath, warmer toilet seat. Definitely would recommend to friends

New and convenient, right in the heart of Ginza. The rooms are very modern and comfortable and one can access both the Hibiya line and Ginza line easily from the hotel. Also, it is a very short walk from the buses that take you to Narita airport. Will definitely return.

BEST. LOCATION. EVER. The hotel is right in the heart of Ginza as it is surrounded by great restaurants, shops and malls (Matsuya, Mitsukoshi, Ginza Core). Subway stations are also just a few steps away from the Hotel (Higashi-ginza station of Tokyo Metro and Toei line; and Ginza station of Tokyo Metro Station) so it's easy to travel to other parts of Tokyo. Lastly, the hotel is within walking distance to airport limousine bus stops (Sukiyabashi or Courtyard Hotel by Marriot). There's also a nearby Don Quixote store!!I'm so glad we stayed here!

This hotel is situated in an excellent location at the heart of Ginza famed for its excellent shopping and many restaurants and bars with 2 major department stores a few steps away. We stayed 5 nights on the top floor and found our room very clean, quiet and comfortable.. Front desk staff were courteous, helpful and spoke good English. The dining area was a little small although the buffet breakfast we sampled proved more than adequate. The restaurant also provides buffet lunches and diner although we did not try these, preferring instead to sample the various cuisines of the many restaurants and cafes in the surrounding area. We will stay here again.

We were really happy with our stay here. Our room was excellent. Super-clean, elegantly designed furniture and interior plus and wonderfully attentive staff. Our stay at this hotel went beyond our expectations.

The hotel is small, nicely designed, very clean and very well- run. The rooms, though rather small like most Tokyo hotels, have everything one needs- large bathroom with a separate wet/dry area, Japanese modern toilet with warm seat and automatic flush, flat screen TV, in-room coffee/tea sets. They even provide pajamas, free bottled water, all good quality toiletries. The in room lighting is controlled by the panel by the bed, you can even dim the light. Good quality bed/sheets. All of those make a very comfortable stay. Two large elevators, never have to wait long for one to come. Free Wifi works ok, in some rooms however rather slow. The Reception team are very polite, helpful and efficient. They gave us two twin rooms next to each other exactly per our request and on non-smoking floors, not all small Tokyo hotels accommodate us like this before.The hotel is really in a great Ginza location, 2 short blocks from Matsuya Department store and very near Mitsukoshi, both have marvelous food floors. It is near Ginza and Higashi-Ginza metro stations where you can easily take a ride to many other sites like Asakusa & Omotesando. Tokyo station is a short taxi ride away -so convenient for those who take Narita Express from the airport, perhaps about 20 min walk. Yurakucho train station & Tsukiji Fish market is about 10 min walk in the opposite direction. There is a FamilyMart and a Starbucks you can see from the lobby.In all, it is a great small hotel, truly a gem and at a very reasonable price for Ginza. Our family have visited Tokyo many times before and tried many hotels, Solaria is the one we will come back to the next time. Our special thanks to Hatano San at the reception who kindly helped getting the laptop we forgot on the plane and for arranging our airport transportation.

the room is too small, but very fashionable, beautiful decoration and very new. it is near to Ginza station, very convenient to have a trip in Tokyo.i like it.....but the staff is not very nice and not good to the staffs we met in hotel of Yokohama.

I stayed at the hotel Monterey and moved to this hotel for one night. I actually like this one a lot better. It's clean, modern and very convenient location. The shampoo, conditioner and body wash is really good stuff, a lot better than any hotel stuff I've ever used. There is a ramen place right across the street that has great noodles. I would definitely recommend this hotel to any traveller to Tokyo.

The hotel is efficient and clean, the rooms are small as you would expect in Tokyo, but the location of the hotel more than made up for it. it's right in the centre of Ginza close to all the shops. Despite its location the rooms are quiet and has all the amenities you would need. For the location it is very good value for money.

In the centre of Ginza shopping area, the hotel is located in a quiet street. Being one of the last hotels available for booking, we did not know what to expect. We were happily surprised to find a clean, comfortable hotel with all amenities available. The only "downside", if one wishes to call it that, might be that wifi is available in the lounge only. But it works perfectly well and also two computers may be used free of charge, which suited us nicely.

We stayed here for 3 nights in August 2013. It was our first time in Japan so we had no idea which neighborhood to stay in. Now I know each neighborhood has its on quirk and getting around to another area via their subway is super convenient. It might take time to figure thetrain system but it's not that difficult.Location - The hotel is in a very safe area. There is a subway line really close by but it's not a major line. Not the station to use your JR PASS if you purchase one. Right around the corner is a family mart which we got water/snacks/breakfast daily. There are restaurants nearby but we didn't venture out there much since we were sightseeing daily.Room - It's classic, modern, and clean. We had 3 ppl in the room and there was just enough space with our luggage. The beds were comfy and so were the PJ given to wear nightly. The bathroom had everything so you don't need to pack anything but your personal stuff.Service - We didn't use much of this but our room was clean and we were given new toiletries daily!If you want to stay in GINZA then stay here!

New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is the ideal launchpad to explore the fancy Ginza area. In term of transportation, it's minutes' walk to Higashiginza and Ginza station, most convenient to get on a subway to explore other parts of Tokyo. Major shopping malls are just one or two blocks away, including the famous Pedestrian Heaving on weekends. We can't fault our hotel room. It's really modern and clean with ample space and big bathroom. Not much of a view outside the window but that didn't bother us much. In fact, this hotel was the most comfortable to stay in during our 4 week trip in Japan (with the exception of our ryokan stay in Hakone).Two word summary: Highly Recommended.

So convenient to reach by walk at Ginza the main area (3 minutes), Tsukiji (10 minutes) and Marunouchi (15-20 minutes). Good and easy connection to Tokyo station, Shibuya, Omotesando, ebisu, Roppongi and even Shinjyuku by 1 metro without change. Not big room, but very modern and new design hotel with a reasonable price. This price staying at Ginza is even cheap, I can say. I always stayed in Shibuya area for conveniency, but this is the first time I found that Ginza is also good place to stay for Tokyo trip. Better to stay at the higher floor with a nicer view

I come here about 4times a year - excellent newly built business hotel right in the middle of Ginza. There is even direct access by train to Haneda airport allowing you to reach Haneda within around 30 - 40 Minutes.

The appearance was great. The staff bare super friendly and helpful and the rooms are very clean. The rooms are small but compact with everything u may need from a razor to a toothbrush and paste! The Lobby is welcoming and modern and it is very close to everything. Only tip, many can drivers find it hard to find I you have someone who can write the name in kanji it would be helpful or give landmarks like close to Waco Department store , close to mikimoto and Starbucks.

My husband and I stayed at this hotel end of April 2013. We had one night in Tokyo and wanted a base close to Tokyo station and some good restaurants etc. Solaria was the perfect option. Located just off of the main shopping street in Ginza, not far from transport links, Shinkansen and metro etc. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful with excellent restaurant recommendations etc.Room is very small but it seems most are in the Far East. Perfectly formed, big bed, small desk area and small bathroom. The Japanese toilets are incredible. Enjoy!Breakfast was very tasty. Buffet style. Lots on offer from cereals and toasts to steamed dumplings and sashimi. Restaurant is really nicely decorated. One small gripe I have was on arrival. We had flown for 12 hours through the night, spent 2 hours getting from Narita airport, and we were told our room was ready but we would have to pay extra to get in to it early. When you are already paying for a full day and you've clearly traveled a long way I can not see why they can't just let you in to the room. Seems a little tight. That aside, we would definitely stay at Solaria again. Ginza is great for shopping and a few minutes by taxi from Tokyo station. Also, a good walk to the fish market which is worth a look. Short walk to Imperial Palace.

Good at price, location, service, equipment, room size. The staff are all nice and can speak english. One of them can speak chinese. The double bed was too soft so we disturbed each other's sleep when we moved.

We passed up the well-known hotels in Ginza, since the price was attractive at the Solaria. We worried when the taxi didn't find it at first. But once inside the discreet reception, our feelings changed for the better. The first room they showed us was too small for our tastes, but they kindly switched us for a reasonable extra charge. We liked the elegant design, the clever functionality of the amenities, the restaurant for dinner, the closeness of various Starbucks for a better-value breakfast, and above all the location: in the heart of busy Ginza, but just off the main streets with their noise. The staff might do with speaking a little more English, but that is the same across Japan. They were all very helpful. We will return! But we see we will soon have to book early.

review_body: Very nice and clean Hotel in the middle of Ginza.The double room is little bit small, but for a period no longer than 1 week is perfect.Amenities are perfect and the cleanliness is stunning.Highly recommended.

Just as many others have stated, this hotel is in a perfect location- just 100 yards from the major crossing in Ginza and the Ginza station. The hotel feels brand new. the decor and cleanliness is immaculate.If you get a discounted room then you are likely to get a room with frosted glass rather than a proper transparent view of the outside world. You can open these windows a bit but you then see the reason. The next building is only a cars width away and there is a sturdy fire escape just outside your window. So they are protecting your privacy. I was there for nearly a week and this did begin to grate on me but if you are staying just a night or two really isn't an issue.Breakfast at 2100? yen (£15) was a good buffet with a leaning to anti-pasti. You'll know what I mean when you see it. excellent quality ingredients and proper homemade scramble egg.The front staff can understand most english. You can write to them and they get the message and write back in English which is very useful.I thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Following the reviews of other fellow TripAdvisor reviewers; I too highly recommend this hotel. It is about two or three blocks from the main Ginza shopping and dining area. When I stayed here, the hotel was roughly 1.5 years old but still looked new and kept in excellent condition. I couldn't book through their website, so I used a third party booking site. Arrived at the hotel with no problems. Rate was about 14,000 yens a night for a twin bed room which roughly translates to about $ 150 USD, which is considered a bargain since Ginza's hotel rates can be quite expensive. Room was spacious enough and comfortable. The bathroom blew my mind away as it was larger than what I've seen in other hotels in most of Asia. The shower and bathtub are in the same space but there is a door that separates it from the sink and toilet. The door can actually close all the way and you'll feel it to be secured. My only complaint about the shower was the water temperature has a tendency to change suddenly from hot to scalding hot and back to hot for no reason. The shower lever, which controls the water temperature is independent of the on and off lever which is convenient so you can always have your specific water temperature preference (in Celsius). The hotel will provide a router for you to plug in and use the internet, which is free of charge. The hotel provides two free daily bottles of water. Didn't try the restaurant on-site. Staff spoke decent English and were helpful with getting around the area. There are two Family Marts (convenience store) in the vicinity of the hotel. One directly across the street and another across from this Family Mart. I had no other complaints for this hotel and found it to be in an ideal location. I highly recommend this hotel to my friends and family, and would stay here again when I return to Tokyo.The Ginza station is just around the corner of the hotel; the JR station (Yurakucho Station) is a 10 minute walk away. Other attractions such as the Tsukiji Fish Market is also a short walk away.

I highly recommend this hotel to those who are into shopping and dining. We used the 45-day early bird special and paid about JY13,000/per night for two people. The hotel is nearly brand new and literally a stone's throw away from Higashi Ginza stations' A8 Exit. (There is a direct train from Haneda Airport to Higashi Ginza. The one-way ticket is JY550, and it's a 27-minute train ride. To get to Haneda, we took the airport limousine bus at the nearby Marriott Courtyard Hotel. We didn't have too much luggage. So we walked there and it took us about 8 minutes. The one-day bus fare was JY900.This is a bit more expensive than the train, but it helped us avoid the rush hour crowd in the morning.) You can't beat the location. There's a Family Mart convenience store right across the street and numerous local eateries and restaurants nearby.The famed Tsukiji fish market and tons of brand stores are just within walking distances. Even though it's a budget hotel, it's tastefully decorated and equipped with humidifiers and a suit presser. Yes, the bed is TINY, but hello, this is Ginza in Japan...

review_body: Was searching for a nice hotel to stay in for twin sharing in expensive Tokyo when we finally went with this hotel for 7 nights.It was wonderful! Very clean, new and nice room of reasonable size with 2 different train network just a stonethrow away right in Ginza. For the extremely fussy folks, the bath tub and standing shower is a separate enclosed area so you will always get a dry and nice sink and toilet bowl.Overall: Would definitely recommend this hotelLikes:- Good location and highly accessible in the heart of Ginza- Very clean room esp the bedsheets- Free wi-fi in room (request for router from front-desk)- Separate standing shower / bath tub from the toilet- 1 train stop away from Tsukiji & Tokyo station- Very friendly & polite staffs- Plenty of eateries nearbyDislikes:- Far away from Shinjuku & Shibuya- You need to self-deliver your laundry to the front-desk- No cable TV - all the free channels programme were boring / dated shows

Found the hotel when wandering the streets of Ginza. We were looking for an alternative to the drab place we were staying at. Warm welcome and good weekday rate offered, which made up for the rather hefty weekend rate. Loved the room on the 13th floor. Generous size considering it's Japan. THE most quiet aircon ever - loved it!Can't comment on breakfast. Free wifi in the lobby and picked uo someone else's unprotected one in the room. Loved the location right in between two different metro line.

The Solaria has a fantastic central location, walking distance from the Imperial Gardens and Fish Market, and short blocks from Ginza's main shopping street. The train to Haneda airport (35 minutes) is only a few hundred feet away. Rooms are very modern, clean, well appointed. The staff are friendly and speak English. My single room is on the small size by American standards, but big enough for 2 people. The hotel is very quiet. The price is very reasonable.

Booked this hotel via my office in Tokyo for a 3 night stay and was pleasently surprised with the quality of the rooms and not to mention the location. I was very satisfied with eveything with the exception of one little thing which caught me by surprise. The surprise was that you cannot make telephone calls from the room instead the guest has to go to the hotel Reception and they dial the call for you. I find this very awakward for a business hotel. I hope Solaria change because if not I will not use the hotel even though I had a good stay.
Newly opened sept 2011. Very clean and well equipped hotel. Staff was helpful.
